title.narrative: RHDI -Food Sec. & GBV Resp. to COVID-19

description.narrative: Reconnect Health Development Initiative (RHDI) is a not-for-profit, non-government organization headquartered in Nigeria for 6 years to promote awareness of mental health issues, and provide psychological treatment and support services for individuals, groups andcommunities. Working together with relevant stakeholders, we affirm our commitment to support and alleviate the sufferings of persons affected by gender-based violence, disasters, crises, violence, mental health disorders, psychological and substance abuse problems. We believe no one should face a mental health problem alone and we would not give up until everyone in need of psychological support access the support the require. With nearly 50 seasoned professionals comprising of Clinical and Behavioural Psychologists, Educational and Child Psychologists, Consultant Psychiatrists, Public Health Specialists and Counsellors. With our contribution to the psychosocial space is unparalleled. This project will build on the strengths and lessons learned from previous and ongoing programs led by Oxfam. Specifically, the action will complement the ongoing interventions of the EU Support to Food Security and Resilience in Northern Nigeria# (PROACT) in Adamawa and Kebbi states in northern Nigeria. The project is benefiting over 25,000 vulnerable farming households in 80 rural communities, 70% of whom will be women. These Vulnerable households, were in the very poor and poor categories prior to Oxfam intervention in target locations of this project, and were beginning to attain comfortable positions in terms offood security and livelihoods outcomes before the COVID 19 pandemic struck. These populations are now at risk of having their strengthened resilience attenuated as a result of COVID-19 pandemic. The project will also use the findings of the recent rapid care analysis conducted in Adamawa and Kebbi address gender based violence issues arising from the Covid 19 pandemic. The power relations which places women as the subordinate gender groups withinthis society, leaves the women vulnerable to GBV violence, as there is a power imbalance between men and women as highlighted by the RGA will also be addressed by this Project.

Working together with relevant stakeholders, we affirm our commitment to support and alleviate the sufferings of persons affected by disasters, mental disorder, psychological and substance abuse problems. We believe no one should face a mental health challenge alone and we would not give up until everyone in need of psychological support access the required. Reconnect HDI has nearly 50 seasoned professionals comprising of Clinical and Behavioural Psychologists, Educational and Child Psychologists, Consultant Psychiatrists, Public Health Specialists and Counsellors. With our partners from the public, privateand NGO sectors, our contribution to the psychosocial space is unparalleled Our Objectives are: * To raise awareness and combat stigma on mental illness through culturally appropriate methods. * To care and protect the wellbeing and rights of vulnerable population including survivors of gender based violence. * To promote access and availability of psychosocial and treatment services. * To host research on mental health to inform policies and sustain wellbeing of beneficiaries. * To strengthen partnerships and platforms of support for individuals, communities and groups.
